conclusion: A Stirling cycle involves four processes: two isothermal and two isochoric.
The P-V diagram shows states A, B, C, and D with processes A→B and C→D being isothermal.
In an isothermal process, temperature remains constant, so PV = constant.
In an isochoric process, volume remains constant, so pressure is proportional to temperature.
The rate distribution curve of gas molecules is described by the Maxwell-Boltzmann distribution and depends on temperature.

premise: A→B: Isothermal expansion. Temperature remains constant.
conclusion: The rate distribution curve remains the same during A→B.

premise: B→C: Isochoric cooling. Volume remains constant, pressure decreases, temperature decreases.
conclusion: The rate distribution curve shifts towards lower speeds and narrows during B→C.

premise: C→D: Isothermal compression. Temperature remains constant.
conclusion: The rate distribution curve remains the same during C→D.

premise: D→A: Isochoric heating. Volume remains constant, pressure increases, temperature increases.
conclusion: The rate distribution curve shifts towards higher speeds and broadens during D→A.

premise: From state D to state A, temperature increases.
conclusion: The velocity distribution curve of gas molecules changes from state D to state A.
